definition: 1)  expressing a threat of harm or violence
2)  (of the sky, clouds, etc.) showing that bad weather is likely
examples: The house seemed less threatening in the cold light of day.
The sky was dark and threatening.
I found an extremely threatening message on my answering machine.
adopting a threatening posture towards an opponent
people who send threatening letters or make obscene phone calls

definition: the practice of helping the poor and those in need, especially by giving money
examples: Hospitals were built as a result of private philanthropy and government intervention.
word_origin: early 17th cent.: via late Latin from Greek philanthrōpia, from philanthrōpos ‘man-loving’, from philein ‘to love’ + anthrōpos ‘human being’.
